headline.main: Court to Say If Cigarette Makers Can Be Sued for Smokers' Cancer

byline.original: By LINDA GREENHOUSE, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether cigarette makers can be sued for failing to provide adequate warning of the dangers of smoking even though they provided warning labels required by Federal law. The case, brought by the family of a New Jersey woman, Rose Cipollone, who died of lung cancer after 42 years as a smoker, promises to be a watershed in smoking opponents' long and largely unsuccessful legal battle to hold cigarette manufacturers liable for the health effects of smoking.
